metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data from January 1, 2015 to April 17, 2015 from huangcaogou station, upstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located in huangcaogou village, ebao town, qilian county, qinghai province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.7312e, 38.0033n and 3137m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 5m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm underground, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe is buried at 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (in Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: percentage).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question, and there are many questions about the measured wind direction of the station;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: September 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.The station was demolished after April 17.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年4月17日黑河水文气象观测网上游黄草沟站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县峨堡镇黄草沟村，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.7312E, 38.0033N，海拔3137m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据，该站风向测量值疑问较多；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。4月17日后该站拆除。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。一源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，一源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测，这些参数和观测无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高度的四分量辐射（使用四分量辐射计测量），以及4.5米高度的湍流通量（使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度协方差系统测量）。土壤热通量使用位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型也能可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期的气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型是临时雪，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素不能通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游地区运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无缝的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个用于雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和飘雪（漂雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）从2014年1月1日到2017年12月31日以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景（如冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学）的科学家发布，预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂浮雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成、分布式和多尺度的水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Example.AnswerEn: A snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments was used to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes. The components observed included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE), and blowing (drifting) snow flux.

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting meteorological data in alpine regions, and how is it addressed?
Example.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集气象数据面临的一个挑战是什么，以及如何解决这个问题？
Example.AnswerEn: One challenge in collecting meteorological data in alpine regions is the harsh climate and high altitude, which can lead to data scarcity. This challenge is addressed by establishing a network of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations to ensure consistent and comprehensive data collection.
Example.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集气象数据的一大挑战是恶劣的气候和高海拔，这可能导致数据稀缺。为了解决这一挑战，建立了一套自动气象站（AMS）和超级气象站网络，以确保数据收集的持续性和全面性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the main components and instruments involved in a multiscale hydrometeorological observation network?
Definition.QuestionCn: 多尺度水文气象观测网络的主要组成部分和仪器是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: A multiscale hydrometeorological observation network consists of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs), snow observation superstations, and frozen ground superstations. These stations use instruments such as four-component radiometers, eddy covariance systems, and infrared cameras to measure variables like air temperature, wind speed, snow depth, and soil moisture across various scales.
Definition.AnswerCn: 一个多尺度水文气象观测网络由自动气象站（AMSs）、雪观测超级站和冻土超级站组成。这些站点使用四分量辐射计、涡度协方差系统和红外相机等仪器，测量空气温度、风速、雪深和土壤湿度等变量，覆盖不同的尺度。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'component temperatures' in the context of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的背景下，“组分温度”的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the TSEB model, 'component temperatures' refer to the separate temperatures of the soil and canopy. These temperatures are crucial for accurately estimating evaporation and transpiration rates, as the model uses them to differentiate the energy exchange between soil and vegetation, which is necessary for calculating the surface fluxes in heterogeneous landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在TSEB模型中，“组分温度”指的是土壤和树冠的独立温度。这些温度对于准确估计蒸发和蒸腾速率至关重要，因为该模型利用它们来区分土壤和植被之间的能量交换，这对于计算异质景观中的表面通量是必要的。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced in hydrological data collection in the alpine regions compared to the strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在高山地区与强对流灌溉农业区，水文数据收集面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the alpine regions, challenges include harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topography, which make consistent data collection difficult. These challenges hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and hydrological models. Conversely, in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, the main challenge is the accurate estimation of surface fluxes due to an incomplete energy balance closure and errors in determining component temperatures from radiometric data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，挑战包括恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这使得持续的数据收集变得困难。这些挑战阻碍了遥感技术和水文模型的发展。相反，在强对流的灌溉农业区域，主要挑战是由于能量平衡闭合不完全和从辐射数据中确定组分温度的误差，导致表面通量的准确估计。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches can ensure the accuracy of hydrometeorological data collected from automated meteorological stations in remote areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论方法可以确保在偏远地区从自动气象站收集的水文气象数据的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: To ensure accuracy, gap-free meteorological and hydrological data are monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). High-resolution datasets are obtained to capture specific processes like freeze-thaw cycles. Observation stations are strategically placed to collect data for investigating meteorological driving forces and for validating alpine hydrological models, ensuring comprehensive coverage and data accuracy.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 为了确保准确性，监测来自一组自动气象站（AMSs）的无间隙气象和水文数据的观测网络。获得高分辨率数据集以捕捉特定过程，如冻融循环。观测站点 strategically 放置，以收集数据以调查气象驱动因素并验证高山水文模型，确保全面覆盖和数据准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can datasets from snow and frozen ground observations be integrated with remote sensing data to improve predictions of hydrological processes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何将雪和冻土观测的数据集与遥感数据集成，以改善水文过程的预测？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data, when combined with snow and frozen ground observations, can improve the prediction of hydrological processes. Due to the complexities of the earth system, integration helps validate and calibrate the uncertainties present in remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions. An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation dataset is essential for providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling and validating remote sensing data, ultimately enhancing the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与雪和冻土观测相结合，可以提高水文过程的预测能力。由于地球系统的复杂性，集成有助于验证和校准遥感数据中存在的不确定性，特别是在高山地区。一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的观测数据集对于提供准确的水文模型强迫数据和验证遥感数据至关重要，最终增强对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, and how do they impact hydrological modeling and research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致高山地区观测数据稀缺的因素有哪些，这些因素如何影响水文建模和研究？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several factors contribute to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit complete and consistent data collection. These challenges hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models, necessitating the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多个因素导致高山地区观测数据的稀缺，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了全面和一致的数据收集。这些挑战妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展，因此需要开发下一代生态系统观测网络和实验。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to estimate soil heat conductivity in alpine regions, and how does this affect hydrological models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区估算土壤热导率具有挑战性，这如何影响水文模型？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is challenging to estimate because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content, and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Accurate site observations are required to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models to address these complexities.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率的估计具有挑战性，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。需要准确的现场观察来评估高山水文模型的参数化，以应对这些复杂性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes errors in the estimation of surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, and how do these errors affect the performance of models like the TSEB?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，表面通量估计中的误差的原因是什么，这些误差如何影响像TSEB这样的模型的性能？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in the estimation of surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas are primarily caused by the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences. This uncertainty can be due to errors in determining the component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. Such errors significantly affect the performance of models like the TSEB, leading to overestimation or underestimation of key parameters like soil and canopy component temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，表面通量估计中的误差主要源于表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。这种不确定性可能是由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定各组成部分温度时出现的误差。这些误差显著影响像TSEB这样的模型的性能，导致土壤和冠层组成部分温度等关键参数的过高或过低估计。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data for estimating evapotranspiration in varied vegetation landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据结合用于估算不同植被景观中的蒸散发的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data can lead to improved accuracy in estimating evapotranspiration by providing a more comprehensive understanding of soil and canopy component temperatures. This integration helps in overcoming the limitations of single-source models and allows for better validation of estimates using techniques like stable isotope analysis and eddy covariance measurements.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合，可以提高蒸散发估算的准确性，因为这提供了对土壤和树冠组件温度的更全面理解。这种整合有助于克服单一来源模型的局限性，并允许使用稳定同位素分析和涡度协方差测量等技术更好地验证估算结果。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop datasets that combine ground-based measurements and remote sensing data for understanding hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么开发结合地面测量和遥感数据的数据集对于理解高山地区的水文过程很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Combining ground-based measurements with remote sensing data is crucial for improving the prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions. This approach addresses the scarcity of observation data due to challenging environmental conditions and technological barriers. It helps in calibrating and validating remote sensing data, thereby enhancing the accuracy of hydrological models and understanding of eco-functions affected by climate change and human activities.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 结合地面测量与遥感数据对于提高高山地区水文过程的预测至关重要。这种方法解决了由于环境条件恶劣和技术障碍导致的观测数据稀缺问题。它有助于校准和验证遥感数据，从而提高水文模型的准确性以及对气候变化和人类活动影响的生态功能的理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumental approaches are used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，用于估算蒸散发的土壤和冠层组分温度的测量仪器方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance (EC) system. High-resolution thermal cameras were employed to observe these temperatures, which were then used as inputs for the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来通过稳定氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差（EC）系统估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。高分辨率热像仪被用来观察这些温度，然后将其作为输入用于双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How do researchers overcome the challenges of collecting consistent hydrometeorological data in alpine regions with complex topography and harsh climates?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何克服在地形复杂和气候恶劣的高山地区收集一致的水文气象数据的挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Researchers established an integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological observation network consisting of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. This network aims to collect consistent data for meteorological driving forces and validate alpine hydrological models, despite the harsh environmental challenges.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 研究人员建立了一个集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象观测网络，该网络由自动气象站（AMSs）和超级站组成，用于雪和冻土观测。该网络旨在收集气象驱动因素的一致数据，并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型，尽管面临严酷的环境挑战。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are implemented for quality control and processing of meteorological data collected over a period in remote high-altitude regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在偏远高海拔地区收集的气象数据的质量控制和处理实施了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection process ensures quality by maintaining a consistent format, marking missing data with specific codes, removing duplicates, and excluding data that exceeds physical limits or instrument ranges. Daily data is collected with a frequency of every 10 minutes, and any data with potential issues is flagged for further review. Additionally, standard procedures for date and time formatting and naming conventions are followed.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集过程通过保持一致的格式、用特定代码标记缺失数据、删除重复数据以及排除超出物理限制或仪器范围的数据来确保质量。每天以每10分钟的频率收集数据，任何可能存在问题的数据都会被标记以便进一步审查。此外，还遵循日期和时间格式以及命名约定的标准程序。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of comprehensive hydrometeorological data in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高山地区收集全面的水文气象数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations equipped with state-of-the-art techniques and instruments, such as the CS725 GammaMONitor for snow water equivalent measurement and FlowCapt for blowing snow flux observation, has enabled comprehensive data collection in alpine regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站（AMSs）和配备先进技术和仪器的超级站的整合，例如用于雪水当量测量的CS725 GammaMONitor和用于观测吹雪通量的FlowCapt，使得在高山地区能够进行全面的数据收集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary for the effective integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations in hydrology research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 有效整合遥感数据与地面观测在水文学研究中的必要条件是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Effective integration requires high-quality, multiscale observation datasets that can validate remote sensing data, addressing uncertainties and providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, particularly in complex and challenging alpine environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 有效的集成需要高质量的多尺度观测数据集，这些数据集能够验证遥感数据，解决不确定性，并为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，特别是在复杂和具有挑战性的高山环境中。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might challenges such as harsh climate and high altitude affect the effectiveness of data collection methods in alpine hydrological research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么诸如恶劣气候和高海拔等挑战可能会影响高山水文研究中数据收集方法的有效性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges such as harsh climate and high altitude can inhibit complete and consistent data collection, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. The scarcity of observation data due to these difficulties has motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 恶劣的气候和高海拔等挑战可能会妨碍完整和一致的数据收集，从而阻碍遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。由于这些困难导致观测数据的稀缺，促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的开发。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might current composite temperature separation approaches be limited in their effectiveness in estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前复合温度分离方法在估算干旱地区的蒸散发时可能有效性有限的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current composite temperature separation approaches might be limited due to errors in derived component temperatures, which are primarily caused by image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, neglecting atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, as well as uncertainties in short- and long-wave radiation transmittances, can contribute to estimation inaccuracies in arid regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法可能受到限制，因为派生的组成温度存在误差，这些误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的，而这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，忽视大气上行辐射和透射率，以及短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性，也可能导致干旱地区估算的不准确。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in ensuring the accuracy of alpine hydrological data collection in harsh climates?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在恶劣气候条件下，确保阿尔卑斯水文数据收集准确性的潜在挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: In the alpine region, several formidable challenges such as cold and harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topographies inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed. This scarcity of observation data hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等多重挑战阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集。这种观测数据的稀缺妨碍了遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how meteorological parameters are accurately measured in remote and high-altitude alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在偏远和高海拔的阿尔卑斯地区如何准确测量气象参数。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Meteorological parameters in remote and high-altitude alpine regions are measured using an integrated observation network that includes automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). These stations are equipped to monitor various parameters such as air temperature, wind speed, humidity, and radiation at set intervals. Additionally, advanced technology like thermal infrared cameras and eddy covariance systems are used to ensure precise data collection even in harsh environments.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在偏远和高海拔的高山地区，气象参数通过一个综合观测网络进行测量，该网络包括自动气象站（AMSs）。这些站点配备了监测空气温度、风速、湿度和辐射等各种参数的设备，并在设定的时间间隔内进行监测。此外，先进的技术如热红外相机和涡度协方差系统也被用于确保在恶劣环境中进行精确的数据收集。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how challenges like harsh climates and complex topography are overcome in data collection for alpine hydrology research.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在高山水文学研究中，如何克服恶劣气候和复杂地形等挑战进行数据收集。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To overcome challenges like harsh climates and complex topography in alpine hydrology research, researchers employ integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks. These networks consist of automatic meteorological stations and superstations for focused observations on snow and frozen ground. The use of wireless sensor networks and advanced remote sensing technologies also helps in capturing spatially distributed data despite the difficult conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了克服高山水文学研究中的恶劣气候和复杂地形等挑战，研究人员采用了综合、分布式和多尺度的观测网络。这些网络由自动气象站和超级站组成，专注于对雪和冻土的观测。无线传感器网络和先进的遥感技术的使用也有助于在困难条件下捕获空间分布的数据。
